member.name: M:Rebex.RebexAsyncResult.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: If true, is called by IDisposable.Dispose. Otherwise it is called by finalizer.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Scp.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the Encoding to use to encode and decode command parameters and server responses.
member.value: The Encoding to use to encode and decode command parameters and server responses. Default is Encoding.Default.
member.remarks: Even though the RFC implies that UTF-8 is to be used to encode all communication, the practice is very different, unfortunately. In the real world, all SFTP servers seem to default to the OS default charset.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Scp.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time in milliseconds before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server. This also means that data transfers only time out after x milliseconds of inactivity, not after x milliseconds from the start of the transfer.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Scp.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is connected.

remarks.p: This property returns the latest known state of the session. When it returns false, the session was either never connected, or no longer connected. When it returns true, the session was connected at the time of the last I/O operation.
Note: There is no guarantee that the session is still connected even though returns true.

member.value: The to use to access a remote server.

member.summary: Gets or sets the logger used by this object.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Sftp.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the Encoding to use to encode and decode command parameters and server responses.
member.value: The Encoding to use to encode and decode command parameters and server responses. Default is Encoding.Default.
member.remarks: Even though the RFC implies that UTF-8 is to be used to encode all communication, the practice is very different, unfortunately. In the real world, all SFTP servers seem to default to the OS default charset.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Sftp.TransferType
member.summary: Gets or sets the data transfer type. Make sure to set the property to the target OS first!
member.value: The file transfer type. Default is Binary.

remarks.para: This setting applies to GetFile, PutFile, Upload and Download methods. It does not apply to GetStream, GetUploadStream and GetDownloadStream methods (those are always binary).

When this property is set to Ascii and is set to Unix, Rebex SFTP will do this:
1. When uploading, all Windows-style CRLF end-of-line sequences in the source file are replaced with Unix-style LF sequences. 2. When downloading, all Unix-style LF end-of-line sequences are replaced with CRLF (any CRLF already in the source data are kept, which means you won't get CRCRLF).

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Sftp.ServerType
member.summary: Gets or sets the server type.
member.value: The server type. Default is Unknown.
member.remarks: Setting this property to Unix causes Rebex SFTP to only treat forward-slash (the '/' character) as directory delimiter instead of both '/' and '\'. Additionally, when set to Unix, setting the property to Ascii enables conversion between Windows-style and Unix-style end-of-line sequences.

member.summary: Gets or sets SFTP object settings.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Sftp.MaxUploadSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed upload speed, in kilobytes/sec. For unlimited speed, set this to zero.
member.value: Maximum allowed upload speed in kilobytes/sec.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Sftp.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time in milliseconds before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server. This also means that data transfers only time out after x milliseconds of inactivity, not after x milliseconds from the start of the transfer.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Sftp.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is connected.

remarks.p: This property returns the latest known state of the session. When it returns false, the session was either never connected, or no longer connected. When it returns true, the session was connected at the time of the last I/O operation.
Note: There is no guarantee that the session is still connected even though returns true.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.RecheckItemExistence
member.summary: In multi-file operations it forces checking, whether currently processing item still exists.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.UsePosixRename
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to use POSIX rename instead of standard SFTP rename (when available).

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.RaiseEventsFromCurrentThread
member.summary: Specifies whether to raise asynchronous events from the current working thread or whether to raise them using a available when an asynchronous operation was started.
member.value: False (default) to raise events using ; true to raise them directly form the current working thread.
member.remarks: Events of synchronous methods are always raised from the current working thread.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.DisablePutFileZeroOffsetTruncate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether Sftp.PutFile method truncates files when a zero remote offset is specified.
member.value: False (default) to truncate files when zero remote offset is specified; true to keep the files.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.DisableFxpStatWorkaround
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that disables workaround for a SSH_FXP_STAT command, which is known not to work correctly on some servers.
member.value: False (default) to keep the workaround working; true to disable the workaround.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.DisablePathNormalization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that disables normalization of paths passed to all commands (paths are used unchanged).
member.value: False (default) to normalize paths; true to keep paths in original form.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.TreatUnknownItemsAsFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying that filesystem items with unknown type (not file nor directory nor symlink) will be processed as files.
member.value: False (default) to throw an exception when an unknown directory item is processed; true to process such item as file.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.DisableRealPathWorkaround
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that disables WS FTP server workaround when opening remote directory.
member.value: False (default) to use the workaround; true to disable the workaround.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.EnableBrokenRealPathWorkaround
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that enables workaround for broken SSH_FXP_REALPATH command used to determine a canonical path when changing or creating a directory.
member.value: True to enable the workaround; false to keep default behavior.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.LogChecksums
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that makes the client calculate checksums of files being uploaded and logs them into the log.
member.value: True to enable checksum logging; false to disable it.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpSettings.RevertSymlinkArguments
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to force the reversal of SSH_FXP_SYMLINK arguments.
member.value: True to force the reversal; false to autodetect.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOptions
member.summary: Multi-file transfer options used by and methods. Use bitwise 'or' operator to specify multiple flags ('|' in C#, 'Or' in VB.NET).

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOptions.Default
member.summary: No options. Only the files in the specified directory are to be transferred. Detected links are not to be skipped - however, this can still be changed by handler.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOptions.Recursive
member.summary: Operation is recursive. Files in the specified directory and all subdirectories are to be transferred. If wildcards are used, all files and subdirectories that match the wildcard are transferred (in case of subdirectories, this means that if a subdirectory name matches, all the files and sub-subdirectories in it are transferred).

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOptions.SkipLinks
member.summary: Detected links are to be skipped - however, this can still be changed by handler.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOptions.ThrowExceptionOnLinks
member.summary: Detected links are to cause an exception to be thrown - however, this can still be changed by handler.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOptions.XCopy
member.summary: Operation is recursive. Files in the specified directory and all subdirectories are to be transferred. If wildcards are used, all files in the current directory (or any of its subdirectories) are transferred if they match the wildcard (this means that all subdirectories are traversed).

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SftpActionOnExistingFiles
member.summary: Specifies the default action to perform when a target file already exists. However, the default action can still be changed using the event.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpActionOnExistingFiles.ThrowException
member.summary: Existing files are to cause the whole multi-file transfer to be canceled and an exception to be raised.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpActionOnExistingFiles.SkipAll
member.summary: Existing files are to be always skipped.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpActionOnExistingFiles.OverwriteAll
member.summary: Existing files are to be always overwritten.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpActionOnExistingFiles.OverwriteOlder
member.summary: Existing files are to be overwritten if they are older than source files. This is strongly discouraged because modification dates are often misreported by SFTP servers, making this mode highly unreliable. We strongly recommend to use a different mode or develop a custom solution using the event.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpActionOnExistingFiles.OverwriteDifferentSize
member.summary: Existing files with different sizes are to be overwritten.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpActionOnExistingFiles.ResumeIfPossible
member.summary: Existing files are to be resumed if they are smaller than source files.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOperation

member.summary: Retrieving of the file system hierarchy was started.

member.summary: Processing of a file was started.

member.summary: File transfer is starting.

member.summary: File was successfully transferred.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOperation.FileSkipped
member.summary: File was skipped.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOperation.FileProcessingFailed
member.summary: File transfer failed or the operation was canceled by user.

member.summary: Directory processing was started.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOperation.DirectoryCreated
member.summary: Directory was successfully created. If directory already exists, this event is not raised.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOperation.DirectorySkipped
member.summary: Directory was skipped.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOperation.DirectoryProcessingFailed

member.summary: File was successfully deleted.

member.summary: Retrieval of the particular directory hierarchy was started.

member.summary: Retrieval of the particular directory hierarchy was skipped (no files or subdirectories of the directory are to be processed).

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferOperation.DirectoryRetrievalFailed
member.summary: Retrieval of the particular directory hierarchy failed or operation was canceled.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType
member.summary: Detailed specification of a problem that occurred during the multi-file transfer.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.FileExists
member.summary: A target file with the same name already exists.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.LinkDetected
member.summary: A symbolic link was detected.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.InfiniteLoopDetected
member.summary: Symbolic link is probably a part of an infinite loop in the file system hierarchy.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.CannotCreateDirectory
member.summary: Cannot create target directory.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.CannotTransferFile
member.summary: Cannot transfer file.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.CannotReadFromDirectory
member.summary: Cannot read from a directory.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.CannotFindFile
member.summary: Cannot find the file which was found while retrieving file system hierarchy earlier.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.FileNameIsInvalidOnTargetFileSystem
member.summary: Name of the file is invalid on the target file system. For example, backslash is a valid filename character on Unix SFTP servers, but invalid in local Windows file system.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.DirectoryNameIsInvalidOnTargetFileSystem
member.summary: Name of the directory is invalid on the target file system. For example, backslash is a valid directory name character on Unix SFTP servers, but invalid in local Windows file system.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.CannotFindDirectory
member.summary: Cannot find the directory which was found while retrieving file system hierarchy earlier.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.CannotFindLink
member.summary: Cannot find the link which was found while retrieving file system hierarchy earlier.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.CannotResolveLink
member.summary: Link is corrupted or its target cannot be found.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.NotFileOrDirectory
member.summary: Currently processed item is neither a file nor a directory.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.OperationCanceled
member.summary: Operation was canceled.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.CannotDeleteFile
member.summary: Cannot delete the file.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferProblemType.CannotDeleteDirectory
member.summary: Cannot delete the directory.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction
member.summary: Specifies the action to resolve the current problem detected using the event.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction.Skip
member.summary: Skip the current problematic item.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction.Overwrite
member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction.OverwriteIfOlder
member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name if it is older than the source file. This is strongly discouraged because modification dates are often misreported by SFTP servers, making this mode highly unreliable. We strongly recommend to select a different action or to develop a custom solution and choose either Overwrite or Skip action instead.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction.OverwriteIfDifferentSize
member.summary: Overwrite target file with the same name if it has a different size.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction.Rename
member.summary: Upload the source file to a different name. NewName of the event argument must be set to the desired name.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction.Retry
member.summary: Retry the current operation again.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction.FollowLink
member.summary: Resolve the symbolic link.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction.Resume
member.summary: Resume target file.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.SftpBatchTransferAction.ThrowException
member.summary: Cancel the whole multi-file transfer. Do no transfer any other files.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.SftpConnectionState
member.summary: Represents the Sftp object connection state.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpConnectionState.Connected
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the object is connected.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SftpConnectionState.NativeErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the Win32 socket error code.
member.remarks: Returns 0 if no socket error code is available.
